attributes.additional_details: Been in hospital costs so much money and adding this extra charge to travel to the hospital is added stress that families shouldn’t have to deal with. Having a child with cancer or a serious illness means you could be at the hospital 3-4 times a week for months, I would like you to exempt theses families from paying clean air charges
attributes.background: I want you to stop the change for clean air zones for families who have a child with a serious illness that requires them to be in hospital

rejection.details:
Decisions about clean air zones and who can be exempt from the charges are a matter for the relevant local authority, not the UK Government or Parliament.

You could raise your issue with a local councillor who represents you. You can find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them, by entering your post code here: https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

You could also raise your issue by contacting the local council who are responsible for implementing the clean air zone.
